title.narrative: OUTPUT 5.1. DEMAND FOR EDUCATION SERVICES

description.narrative: By end 2021, communities, parents, young people and children have the knowledge and are empowered to access quality education services and engage effectively in inclusive community approaches to education, which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Education â€“ General, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 5: By the end of 2022, the most vulnerable preschool and school-age children, adolescents and young people, of both sexes, in the 10 targeted provinces make greater use of inclusive, quality educational services, for improved learning outcomes and receive certification for this.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By end 2021, communities, parents, young people and children have the knowledge and are empowered to access quality educationservices and engage effectively in inclusive community approaches to education

description.narrative: 1,720 members of parents’ associations and mothers’ associations (APE/AME), of whom 120 women, have been trained on different issues in order to meet the educational demands against a target of 1,635, or 105%.In order to strengthen social dialogue, 6,559 youth (2,835 girls) utilize discussion and advocacy platforms on children&39;s education against a target of 19,427, or 34%. The underperformance on this indicator is due to delays in establishing youth mobilization platforms, such as hygiene clubs and girls&39; clubs in the schools. These activities will continue in 2022. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:23/01/2022
